page.title: 12 - TRANSPORT
page.content: The area is badly served by public transport being rural and unprofitably underpopulated. Train services were withdrawn in the 1950s and Bus services are petering out in the early 1980s. The nearest southern railway station is at Pulborough from which trains run to London and Chichester or Bognor Regis quite frequently. A minibus service operates on a regular basis for the over 60's. Other intermittent minibus services run to Petworth and Chichester. The local garage does some taxi work, usually taking people to Gatwick or Heathrow airport, but does not run a regular local taxi service as such. In the summer, a special rambler bus, the 222 runs around a circular route from Arundel stopping on demand anywhere on the route.
